gemini_output: (A) is sarcastic because it implies that beating the #1 team *should* be enough to get Alabama into the playoffs, but the speaker likely knows other factors are involved.  Option (B) is a more straightforward statement.

input:
Which statement is sarcastic?
Options:
(A) You're not allowed to walk in the park, you can only do it on your own property
(B) You're not allowed to smoke in the park, you can only do it on your own property
gemini_output:
(B) You're not allowed to smoke in the park, you can only do it on your own property

The sarcasm lies in the absurdity of suggesting someone smoke only on their own property, as if that somehow magically makes it acceptable.  Option A, while potentially inconvenient, doesn't carry the same level of ironic, mocking implication.
